topics: Case Study: Bauer-Nimr Water Treatment Plant, Oman
Basics of Cost and Schedule Monitoring
Case Study: Turner Construction Company: Project Management Control Systems HBS 9-190-128

assignments.description: Semester long group project on a topic of your choice, presented at the end of the semester.

policies.attendance: Active participation is critical; attendance is required for class discussions and in-class assignments.
policies.late_work: Grace period of up to one week to submit late assignments with a valid excuse.
policies.academic_integrity: Collaboration is encouraged, but individual work should be submitted unless specified otherwise.
policies.accommodations: Stevens is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.course_format: Hybrid, synchronous sessions on Tuesdays from 6:30pm to 9:00pm.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Basic computer and web-browsing skills, live web conferencing using Zoom, required software includes Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
additional_info.support_resources: Contact the Technology Resource and Assistance Center (TRAC) for support.

_metadata.pdf_source: ../StevensCourses\SS2024 CM592 Advanced Controls for the Built Environment.pdf

course_info.title: Advanced Project Controls for the Built Environment

instructor.name: Karim S. Karam
instructor.office_hours: To be arranged individually with students

_metadata.course_description: This course is aimed at providing students with theory, methods and quantitative tools to effectively plan, and construct infrastructure projects.
learning_outcomes: Understand project organizational structures, and project delivery methods
Define project controls, and establish project monitoring systems
